Interface DimensionsDatabaseOptions

All Superinterfaces:
DimensionsObject
public interface DimensionsDatabaseOptions
extends DimensionsObject

Field Summary
static int DBOPTIONS_BOTHPROJECTSTREAMS
          Projects and streams are both active at the base database level.
static int DBOPTIONS_PROJECTSONLY
          Projects are active at the base database level, streams are inactive.
static int DBOPTIONS_STREAMSONLY
          Streams are active at the base database level, projects are inactive.

Method Detail

getProjectStreamOptions

int getProjectStreamOptions(java.lang.Boolean forceQuery)
Deprecated. Use getProjectStreamOptions(boolean) instead.

Do not use this method. It will be removed shortly. Use getProjectStreamOptions(boolean) instead.

getProjectStreamOptions

int getProjectStreamOptions(boolean forceQuery)
Returns an integer value representing whether projects, streams, or both are active in this database.

Most normal client code calling this method should use false for the forceQuery argument. Only if you are writing an administrative tool that could have changed this value should you need to set forceQuery to true.

Parameters:
forceQuery - true to force a database query even if a cached value has already been queried (overuse of this can cause a performance issue) or false if a previously-cached value would be acceptable (this will be the case in most ordinary client code).
Returns:
DBOPTIONS_BOTHPROJECTSTREAMS, DBOPTIONS_PROJECTSONLY or DBOPTIONS_STREAMSONLY

setProjectStreamOptions

void setProjectStreamOptions(int options)
Sets project-stream options on the DimensionsDatabaseOptions object. Note that this method does not commit changes to the database.

Parameters:
options - an integer representing whether projects, streams or both are active in this database.

save

void save()
Commits any updates made to the DimensionsDatabaseOptions object into the database.
